title: Pentakill Q&A
body:
What’s up metalheads!
 
We’re some of the guys behind Pentakill’s debut album, Smite and Ignite. We’ll be around for the next few hours or so to answer any questions you have about the album’s creation, the guests we had contribute, and why Pentakill’s bringing the solo back!
 
We are Praeco (composer, guitars, mixing, programming and production), Riot Kyugene (bass) and ProtoShredanoid (guitars)!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oUiOylPbfV0
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=be1waE9myCU

replies.body: Any plans for a Pentakill Tour? : D

I think it would be possible for us to play Pentakill live in the future... We would definitely have to practice a lot. :) So for the near future, I think it's not so likely, but further in the future and for special occasions... Maybe.

If enough people would wanna see it, it's definitely possible.
the community wants
Me too :0

HELLO DOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOODES *wanananana*

Anyways, here are some of m questions about yer album!

* Was there any specific reason for some of the items you chose as titles? Some of them seem like stuff Pentakill members would get ({{item:3128}} for {{champion:82}}{{champion:30}}, {{item:3075}}->{{champion:2}}{{champion:83}} ). others seem odd ({{item:3056}}???).


* What specific bands were your inspiration for the music and, likewise, what specific bands did you consider picks for Pentakill's personality?


* Do you feel that this is a one time thing or might you go make some music tracks for, say, a champion release or otherwise?


* Any other music genre bands you like to put into LoL? Something classic like Jazz or Classical or maybe something more recent/interesting like J-Rock or Dubstep? (I dislike dubstep but whatever floats yer boat)

Hey CaptainMarvelous,

- For the track names, we just chose the most metal sounding items we could find. This had a lot of debate around it because there are quite a few metal ones, haha (Bloodthirster, Liandry's Torment, etc). As for Ohmwrecker specifically, we gravitated towards that item almost immediately because it sounded exactly like what a lot of prog/djent metal bands name their albums/songs.

- We all had different phases of metal that we went through, so we just drove towards a style of metal that fit best with all of us.

- We're always trying new things and seeing where LoL, music, etc takes us--we don't know the answer to this one, but that's kind of what makes it fun, haha.

- We'll see :D

Will Sona ever get any sound effects for her Pentakill skin, since right now she uses the standard Sona sound effects, which is EXTREMELY unfitting, what with it being these light, happy harp-like sounds that clash with her awesome heavy metal skin, and it just makes the skin incredibly disappointing, which is unfortunate, since the skin is so awesome.

I actually work in SFX for skins specifically, and this is something I've wanted to update for some time. The audio team is cramming hard on a lot of cool stuff right now and this is at the top of my priority list for when I get freed up. Not sure when that will be or if it'll happen--but it bugs me just as much as it bugs you.
Pentakill makes me wanna http://37.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m5hcie0GzY1rrzdauo1_400.gif
Where is Sona ?
Tribush.

The songs Lightbringer and Thornmail obviously both tell stories... are the stories related? Are they lore canon? Could you give us more info about them? ...am I the king mentioned in Thornmail? That would be sweet.
Yes, my king.
Your king is pleased. Keep up the good work!
Would you guys ever do a Pentakill Music Video kinda like a Dethklok animated version?

So why was Orb of Winter an orchestral song? Don't get me wrong I love to listen to music like that, but it totaly ruined my head banging montage throughout your other songs. Could have at least made it a metal fusion like you did with your other 2 instrumental songs. So my question again, Why, Orb of Winter, an orchestral song?

Well, in our twisted minds, Thornmail was kind of the last battle on the field, with all the warriors slaughtering each other and the Pentakill lords of war destroying the last resistance of the enemy's army.

Orb of Winter then is the scenery after the battle - As if you were marching over the battlefield, in between all the dead bodies, lamenting their death and seeing their souls leave their bodies. A requiem, dedicated to the fallen warriors on the battle field.

Tears, my friend, tears. Tears of mead.
Have you considered a second rival band?

Yes yes yes! I was just thinking about this today! Like, a really technical band, very electric, synths, drum machines, etc. The complete opposite of Pentakill's analog and metal.

Imagine Dubstep {{champion:161}} dropping the beat when he uses his ulti. ^______^
Haha, we haven't really thought of that--what kind of band do you guys think would be a Pentakill rival band? And who do you think should go in it?
well you guys already made popstar{{champion:103}} so why not make a pop band to go up against pentakill?
Rap or dubstep or a combo and i think dubstep should be only void champs and rap some of the laid back ones and ninjas
Wub a dub dub, bass in the tub.

Well whatever band it is it should have {{champion:254}}  on Drums, {{champion:120}}  on guitar, {{champion:48}}  on Bass, {{champion:61}}  on Keyboard and {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}}  as the lead singer!
Will there be any new Pentakill albums soon?
Our lovley {{champion:37}} Sona is said to scream in one of the songs, but she's mute! How?!
All lies. Those cravens.
Are there plans for any Pentakill merch? My desk is in serious need of 5 adorable plushies of the Pentakill champs.
There will be CDs of the Pentakill album soon :D
Do yall actually play LoL? And if yall do what are your favorite champs? :DDDD
Haha, yeah we all play quite a bit. My personal favorites are Jinx, Lulu, Wukong, and Nami. Praeco's is Viktor (hipster cred +1). And Protoshredanoid likes Leona.
Any Pentakill related jokes

I think one of the longest running jokes we had while making it was naming riffs after wrestling moves. The riff during the chorus of Thornmail was called the "Double choke slam" because the two tom hits before each downbeat would be grabbing a neck per hand, with the downbeat being us slamming them. Yup. Wrestling. Metal.

You guys sound like you use drop tuning. Don't do that. Please, you'll sound better.

More variety and change it up, don't reuse riffs over and over.

Go on tour with Sabaton.
Not happening. Drop tunings all the way mang.

Technically, Lightbringer is not tuned down at all. It's a seven string :p
For Deathfire, the solos were so fast that we had to tune the recording down so human ears could comprehend all of the notes. The drop tuning is for your own safety.

If Karthus *(Jørn Lande)* is Pentakill's lead singer, as heard in Lightbringer and Thornmail, then who is the "Guest Singer" *(ZP Theart)* they brought in to do vocals for Deathfire Grasp and Last Whisper?

Do you guys have any plans to update Sona's Pentakill skin? In the new splash art she's got some sweet tattoos, but those aren't there in game, so it's a bit misleading now. :p Also, how probable is it that more Pentakill albums will be released in the future? Smite and Ignite is amazing, but a bit short by standards. (At least, my standards) Thanks!  Rock on. \m/
Which song off the album do you consider the most headbangable?
LUCIAN'S THEME OH WAIT HE'S OP, FIX IT FIX IT FIX IT FIX IT
(Last Whisper)
Ohmwrecker come on guys the bass solo lets be real
(bass players unite)
(jumping high five w/ freeze frame)
https://i.chzbgr.com/maxW500/1463272704/h18CA4CC2/
Is Pentakill running a monopoly on the best band in Runeterra, or are they going to have some competition in the future?
How was it working with Jørn Lande?
Jorn is a Golden God

Jorn is one of the most humble dudes we've worked with on a music project. He got really excited to do something 'different' with us and actually ended up knowing a lot about the game's lore, items and champions a week or two after talking to him for the first time. So it was a huge pleasure. His voice is just so good...
